title: Bug 7734: System can be shut down without savefile warnings
OB: When a WSWB session is open with some opened, dirty .txt file, shutting down Windows will cause the loss of the changes in the .txt file.
EB: When shutting down Windows with a WSWB session open and any open, dirty .txt files, a warning or question message box should be displayed to give users a chance to save their changes before the computer is shut down/rebooted.
SR:
To reproduce the issue:
1. Start WSWB and create a new project.
2. Create a text file in the project and add a line of text to it.
3. Notice that the text file is marked as a dirty file.
4. Left click on the Windows Start menu and select the "Shut Down..." command to shut down/reboot the computer.

Expected results:
A warning or question message box should appear, giving users a chance to save their changes before the computer is shut down/rebooted.

Actual results:
The computer is shut down/rebooted immediately without providing any warning or chance to save the dirty files.
